title: [] Thai Chicken Noodle Soup

winePairing.pairingText: Thai can be paired with Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. You could try Side Yard Vineyards Gewurztraminer. Reviewers quite like it with a 4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 8 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Side Yard Vineyards Gewurztraminer
productMatches.description: Side Yard Gewurztraminer is made from selected grapes produced in vineyards of the Pfalz region. Made with 100% Gewurztraminer and fermented in small stainless steel tanks, this is a delightfully aromatic white wine that is perfect for casual enjoyment with meals, especially spicy cuisine, or by itself.

instructions: In a medium sized pot, heat up 2 teaspoons of cooking oil. When the oil is hot, add ginger and turmeric powder and saute until aromatic over low heat.Pour the chicken broth into the pot carefully. Cover the pot with a lid and cook until the broth is bubbling.Add coconut milk, tamarind puree, sambal oelek, fish sauce and brown sugar. Allow the broth to cook until boiling point again, over low heat. This should give you enough time to blanch the noodles.Place the rice stick noodles in a bowl and pour boiling hot water over them, Make sure they are well submerged in the hot water and wait for 5 to 8 minutes until they are softened. Drain and divide equally into two serving bowls.The coconut broth should be bubbling by now.  Add mung bean sprouts and turn off the heat. In the meantime, heat up the shredded chicken in microwave for a minute or so until it is well heated through.Ladle the broth over the noodles. Then top the noodle soup with shredded chicken, lime wedges and sambal oelek. Squeeze the lime before eating. Enjoy!

steps.step: In a medium sized pot, heat up 2 teaspoons of cooking oil. When the oil is hot, add ginger and turmeric powder and saute until aromatic over low heat.
Pour the chicken broth into the pot carefully. Cover the pot with a lid and cook until the broth is bubbling.
Add coconut milk, tamarind puree, sambal oelek, fish sauce and brown sugar. Allow the broth to cook until boiling point again, over low heat. This should give you enough time to blanch the noodles.
Place the rice stick noodles in a bowl and pour boiling hot water over them, Make sure they are well submerged in the hot water and wait for 5 to 8 minutes until they are softened.
Drain and divide equally into two serving bowls.The coconut broth should be bubbling by now.

Add mung bean sprouts and turn off the heat. In the meantime, heat up the shredded chicken in microwave for a minute or so until it is well heated through.Ladle the broth over the noodles. Then top the noodle soup with shredded chicken, lime wedges and sambal oelek. Squeeze the lime before eating. Enjoy!
